TopicTitle: A little turn based "war" idea in ksp... All stock, looking for people

Articles.Content: Well, I`m bored, school is about to be let out, etc. Sooooo, I wanted to do something interesting while waiting for school to end/during summer break. (yes, I know this is overdone) But, i`m thinking of having a (as in the title) turn based war in ksp, so, i`m kind of aiming for a game layout like risk, with a deployment phase, movement phase, and attack phase (not in that order). Each person will have a "space dock" at a randomly selected planet/planetiod/moon, each space dock will allow each player a certain amount of ships (ex. 5 fighters, or one light frigate). As you capture other player`s space docks, you will be able to move you own to a more strategic/better location. Weapon designs won't be limited, as long as they aren`t cheaty, use hacks, or modded. More ideas for rules coming soon, please let me know if you are interested!

Sounds fun. I have diddly in stock warfare experience, but it sounds fun. I'd be interested in participating all the same cause why not. One question: is Kerbal Engineer okay? All it does is add displays for deltaV and whatnot, doesn't add parts or autopilots, and won't mess with save or craft files.
